logic.英释: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

shade.英释: slight darkness or shelter from the direct light of the sun made by something blocking it

cheek.英释: the soft round part of your face below each of your eyes

track.中释: 追踪，〔循着踪迹、气味等〕找寻
track.英释: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc

vital.英释: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

fetch.英释: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

issue.英释: a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

grant.英释: If someone in authority grants you something, or if something is granted to you, you are allowed to have it

slave.英释: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money

award.英释: something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

renew.英释: to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

honor.英释: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

tumor.英释: a mass of diseased cells in your body that have divided and increased too quickly

tough.英释: difficult to do or deal with

scale.英释: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

choke.英释: to be unable to breathe properly because something is in your throat or there is not enough air

yield.英释: the amount of profits, crops etc that something produces

alter.英释: to change, or to make someone or something change

coach.英释: to teach a person or team the skills they need for a sport

faith.英释: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

avail.英释: to be helpful or useful to sb

harsh.英释: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

adapt.英释: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

bogus.英释: not true or real, although someone is trying to make you think it is

moral.英释: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

crash.中释: 〔汽车的〕撞车事故；〔飞机的〕坠毁，失事
crash.英释: an accident in which a vehicle violently hits something else

admit.英释: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

major.英释: to study something as your main subject at college or university

alert.英释: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc

steer.英释: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel

frame.英释: a structure made of wood, metal, plastic etc that surrounds something such as a picture or window, and holds it in place

twist.英释: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape

stake.英释: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

album.英释: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in

grief.英释: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

exile.英释: a situation in which you are forced to leave your country and live in another country, especially for political reasons

trait.英释: a particular quality in someone’s character

snack.英释: a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal

equal.英释: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else

avoid.英释: to prevent something bad from happening

value.英释: to think that someone or something is important

scope.英释: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

rival.英释: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

annoy.英释: If someone or something annoys you, it makes you fairly angry and impatient

merit.英释: to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

forum.英释: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

panic.英释: a sudden strong feeling of fear or nervousness that makes you unable to think clearly or behave sensibly

abuse.英释: to treat someone in a cruel and violent way, often sexually

broad.英释: a road, river, or part of someone’s body etc that is broad is wide

means.英释: a way of doing or achieving something

agent.英释: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

valid.英释: a valid ticket, document, or agreement is legally or officially acceptable

raise.英释: to increase an amount, number, or level

image.英释: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

range.英释: if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

spare.英释: not being used or not needed at the present time

boost.英释: to increase or improve something and make it more successful

solid.英释: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas

solve.英释: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

bride.英释: a woman at the time she gets married or just after she is married

saint.英释: someone who is given the title ‘saint’ by the Christian church after they have died, because they have been very good or holy

delay.英释: to wait until a later time to do something

organ.英释: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

imply.英释: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

react.英释: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

needy.英释: having very little food or money

stale.英释: not interesting or exciting any more

frown.英释: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

virus.英释: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

minor.英释: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

grain.英释: the seeds of crops such as corn, wheat, or rice that are gathered for use as food, or these crops themselves

cater.英释: To cater to a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want

favor.英释: to prefer someone or something to other things or people, especially when there are several to choose from

plant.英释: a factory or building where an industrial process happens

legal.英释: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

picky.英释: someone who is picky only likes particular things and not others, and so is not easy to please

steal.英释: to take something that belongs to someone else

fussy.英释: very concerned about small, usually unimportant details, and difficult to please

bless.英释: if God blesses someone or something, he helps and protects them

asset.英释: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

lodge.英释: to pay to live in a room in someone’s house

cheat.英释: to behave in a dishonest way in order to win or to get an advantage, especially in a competition, game, or examination

steep.英释: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

swift.英释: happening or done quickly and immediately

lobby.英释: to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

seize.英释: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

block.英释: the distance along a city street from where one street crosses it to the next

acute.英释: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

blame.英释: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

shock.英释: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

fancy.英释: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable

apply.英释: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something

essay.英释: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

joint.英释: involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them

grave.英释: the place in the ground where a dead body is buried

guilt.英释: the fact that you have broken an official law or moral rule

trace.英释: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed

wreck.英释: to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

drunk.英释: unable to control your behaviour, speech etc because you have drunk too much alcohol

cliff.英释: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

elect.中释: 选举， 推选； 选择
elect.英释: to choose someone for an official position by voting

union.中释: 工会， 联盟； 联合， 团结； 一致
union.英释: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

chill.中释: 寒冷， 寒气； 风寒， 寒战

toast.中释: 烘， 烤； 向…祝酒， 为…干杯
toast.英释: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something

aside.英释: moved to one side or away from you

spoil.英释: things taken by an army from a defeated enemy, or things taken by thieves

ridge.中释: 脊， 山脊； 垄， 埂， 脊状突起
ridge.英释: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

pilot.英释: to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

focus.英释: the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

wrist.英释: the part of your body where your hand joins your arm

flour.中释: 面粉； 粉， 粉状物质
flour.英释: a powder that is made by crushing wheat or other grain and is used for making bread, cakes etc

camel.英释: a large desert animal with a long neck and either one or two  hump s (= large raised parts )  on its back

roast.英释: a large piece of roasted meat

lover.英释: someone’s lover is the person they are having a sexual relationship with but who they are not married to

arrow.中释: 箭， 箭状物； 箭头符号
arrow.英释: a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a  bow

crawl.中释: 爬， 爬行； 缓慢地行进
crawl.英释: to move along on your hands and knees with your body close to the ground

towel.英释: a piece of cloth that you use for drying your skin or for drying things such as dishes

surge.中释: 大浪， 波涛； 高涨； 汹涌

basis.中释: 基础， 根据； 原则
basis.英释: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed

tutor.中释: 导师；家庭教师，私人教师
tutor.英释: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

unite.英释: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

unity.中释: 单一， 统一， 团结； 和睦， 协调
unity.英释: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

extra.中释: 额外的事物， 额外费用
extra.英释: an amount of something, especially money, in addition to the usual, basic, or necessary amount

chief.中释: 首领， 长官； 酋长， 族长

marry.中释: 娶， 嫁； 为…证婚； 结婚， 结合
marry.英释: if you marry someone, you become their husband or wife

decay.英释: the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

cargo.英释: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

drift.中释: 漂流； 大意， 主旨； 趋势
drift.英释: a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

chaos.英释: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

input.英释: to put information into a computer

bathe.英释: to wash yourself or someone else in a bath

chase.中释: 追逐， 追赶； 追求
chase.英释: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

canal.英释: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

ankle.英释: the joint between your foot and your leg

charm.英释: to attract someone and make them like you, sometimes in order to make them do something for you

chart.中释: 用图表表示， 在图上表示
chart.英释: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records

chest.中释: 胸腔， 胸膛； 箱子
chest.英释: the front part of your body between your neck and your stomach

video.英释: a copy of a film or television programme, or a series of events, recorded on videotape

stare.英释: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored

slope.英释: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes

solar.中释: 太阳的， 日光的； 太阳能的

layer.英释: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

theme.英释: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

smash.中释: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
smash.英释: the loud sound of something breaking

sword.英释: a weapon with a long pointed blade and a handle

merry.英释: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas

bloom.中释: 花，开花，开花期；青春焕发

gross.中释: 总的； 严重的； 粗俗的； 臃肿的

fibre.英释: the parts of plants that you eat but cannot  digest  . Fibre helps to keep you healthy by moving food quickly through your body.

wagon.中释: 四轮马车， 大篷车； 铁路货车， 客货两用车
wagon.英释: a strong vehicle with four wheels, used for carrying heavy loads and usually pulled by horses

stack.英释: If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles

crack.英释: a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

rally.英释: a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

prime.英释: to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

loyal.英释: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

court.中释: 法院， 法庭； 庭院； 宫廷； 球场
court.英释: an area made for playing games such as tennis

route.英释: a way from one place to another

adult.英释: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions

Bible.英释: TheBible is the holy book on which the Jewish and Christian religions are based

rouse.中释: 惊起； 唤起； 唤醒
rouse.英释: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

grasp.英释: the way you hold something or your ability to hold it

spark.英释: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

rigid.中释: 严格的； 死板的； 刚硬的， 僵硬的
rigid.英释: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change

staff.英释: to be or provide the workers for an organization

blast.英释: to damage or destroy something, or to injure or kill someone, using a gun or a bomb

purse.英释: a small bag in which women keep paper money, coins, cards etc

trail.英释: to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

prior.英释: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

creep.英释: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

strap.英释: If you strap something somewhere, you fasten it there with a strap

grape.英释: one of a number of small round green or purple fruits that grow together on a  vine . Grapes are often used for making wine

straw.中释: 稻草； 麦秆吸管， 吸管
straw.英释: a thin tube of paper or plastic for sucking up liquid from a bottle or a cup

graph.英释: a drawing that uses a line or lines to show how two or more sets of measurements are related to each other

blank.英释: an empty space on a piece of paper, where you are supposed to write a word or letter

title.中释: 标题， 题目； 称号， 头衔； 权利， 权益
title.英释: the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc

relax.中释: 放松， 松弛； 放宽， 缓和
relax.英释: to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

grand.中释: 宏伟的； 重大的； 傲慢的； 派头大的； 绝佳的； 全部的

thick.中释: 厚的，密的，浓的；不清楚的，口音重的
thick.英释: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

cigar.英释: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up

pitch.中释: 投掷；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调
pitch.英释: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

being.中释: 存在； 生物， 生命

curse.中释: 天谴； 祸害， 祸根
curse.英释: something that causes trouble, harm etc

upset.英释: an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

curve.英释: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle

heave.中释: 举起； 起伏， 升降
heave.英释: a strong rising or falling movement

torch.中释: 火炬， 火把； 手电筒
torch.英释: a small electric lamp that you carry in your hand

radar.英释: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

opera.英释: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

blade.中释: 刀刃， 刀片， 叶片
blade.英释: the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

strip.英释: a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

ideal.英释: a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

occur.中释: 发生， 出现， 存在； 被想起， 被想到

broom.英释: a large brush with a long handle, used for sweeping floors

trash.英释: to destroy something completely, either deliberately or by using it too much

infer.中释: 推论， 推断； 猜想
infer.英释: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

blend.英释: to combine different things in a way that produces an effective or pleasant result, or to become combined in this way

stain.英释: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

waken.英释: to wake up, or to wake someone up

mercy.中释: 仁慈， 宽容； 恩惠； 幸运
mercy.英释: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

patch.英释: to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it

orbit.英释: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

spray.英释: liquid which is forced out of a special container in a stream of very small drops

flood.英释: a very large amount of water that covers an area that is usually dry

jewel.英释: a valuable stone, such as a diamond

stiff.中释: 硬的，僵直的；不灵活的；拘谨的，生硬的；费劲的；强烈的
stiff.英释: if someone or a part of their body is stiff, their muscles hurt and it is difficult for them to move

ratio.英释: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

shrug.英释: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

crane.中释: 起重机， 摄影升降机； 鹤
crane.英释: a large tall machine used by builders for lifting heavy things

beard.英释: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

spill.英释: when you spill something, or an amount of something that is spilled

owing.英释: if money is owing, it has not yet been paid to the person who should receive it

dense.中释: 密集的， 浓厚的； 密度大的
dense.英释: made of or containing a lot of things or people that are very close together

allow.中释: 允许， 准许； 同意给； 承认； 允许…进入
allow.英释: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

beast.中释: 兽， 野兽， 牲畜； 凶残的人， 令人厌憎的人
beast.英释: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

shave.英释: if a man has a shave, he cuts off the hair on his face close to his skin using a  razor

trend.英释: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

arise.中释: 出现； 由…引起； 起身， 起床
arise.英释: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

flock.英释: a group of sheep, goats, or birds

thumb.英释: the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

punch.中释: 猛击； 冲床； 穿孔机； 力量， 效力
punch.英释: a strong effective way of expressing things that makes people interested

event.中释: 事件， 大事， 事变
event.英释: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

sting.英释: a wound or mark made when an insect or plant stings you

haste.中释: 急速， 急忙； 草率

craft.中释: 工艺， 手艺； 船， 航空器
craft.英释: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do

float.中释: 浮动， 漂浮； 飘动
float.英释: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

spade.英释: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

error.中释: 错误， 谬误， 差错

Negro.英释: a word for a black person, usually considered offensive

weave.英释: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom

vague.英释: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

handy.中释: 手边的， 便于使用的

score.英释: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

quote.中释: 引文， 引语； 报价， 牌价； 引号
quote.英释: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

fairy.英释: a small imaginary creature with magic powers, which looks like a very small person

mayor.英释: the person who has been elected to lead the government of a town or city

hobby.英释: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

swing.英释: a seat hanging from ropes or chains, usually used by children to play on by moving it forwards and backwards using their legs

lease.中释: 出租； 租得， 租有
lease.英释: to use a building, car etc under a lease

scout.中释: 侦察员，侦察机，侦察舰；童子军
scout.英释: a girl who is a member of an organization for girls that teaches them practical things

fleet.英释: a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

rural.英释: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

shell.英释: to fire shells from large guns at something

loose.中释: 松的； 不精确的， 不严密的； 散漫的

rifle.英释: a long gun which you hold up to your shoulder to shoot

paste.英释: to stick something to something else using glue

jeans.英释: trousers made of denim(= a strong, usually blue, cotton cloth )

laser.英释: a piece of equipment that produces a powerful narrow beam of light that can be used in medical operations, to cut metals, or to make patterns of light for entertainment

medal.中释: 奖牌， 奖章， 勋章
medal.英释: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

label.英释: to attach a label onto something or write information on something

swear.英释: to use rude and offensive language

brave.英释: dealing with danger, pain, or difficult situations with courage and confidence

forth.中释: 向前； 向外， 往外
forth.英释: going out from a place or point, and moving forwards or outwards

swell.中释: 波浪起伏； 鼓起， 隆起； 增强
swell.英释: the roundness or curved shape of something

local.中释: 地方性的； 本地的； 局部的； 狭隘的
local.英释: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

crude.中释: 简陋的， 天然的； 粗鲁的， 粗俗的
crude.英释: not exact or without any detail, but generally correct and useful

royal.英释: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

glove.英释: a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm

naked.英释: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

trial.中释: 试， 试验； 审判； 讨厌的人
trial.英释: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

moist.英释: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

cable.中释: 缆， 索， 电缆； 电报
cable.英释: a plastic or rubber tube containing wires that carry telephone messages, electronic signals, television pictures etc

brass.中释: 黄铜， 黄铜器， 铜管乐器
brass.英释: a very hard bright yellow metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  zinc

media.中释: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
media.英释: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

shift.中释: 转换， 转变； 轮班
shift.英释: a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

erect.英释: to build something such as a building or wall

mount.英释: used as part of the name of a mountain

flash.英释: a bright light that shines for a short time and then stops shining

devil.中释: 魔鬼， 恶魔； 家伙， 人
devil.英释: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

grace.英释: to make a place or an object look more attractive

boast.中释: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话

hence.中释: 因此， 所以； 今后

pinch.英释: A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger

grind.英释: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

urban.中释: 城市的， 都市的； 住在都市的

flame.中释: 火焰， 光辉； 热情
flame.英释: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire

rebel.英释: someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

usage.中释: 使用； 对待； 惯用法
usage.英释: the way that words are used in a language

crush.中释: 压碎， 碾碎； 摧毁， 压垮
crush.英释: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

slice.英释: to cut meat, bread, vegetables etc into thin flat pieces

frost.英释: very cold weather, when water freezes

truly.英释: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

liver.英释: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood

trunk.中释: 树干； 大衣箱， 皮箱； 汽车后备箱； 象鼻
trunk.英释: the thick central woody stem of a tree

slide.中释: 滑动； 滑道， 滑面； 幻灯片
slide.英释: a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

waist.英释: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

flesh.英释: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones

scold.英释: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done

crust.中释: 面包皮， 硬外皮； 外壳， 地壳
crust.英释: the hard brown outer surface of bread

width.中释: 宽阔， 广阔； 宽度
width.英释: the distance from one side of something to the other

dairy.英释: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made

board.英释: to get on a bus, plane, train etc in order to travel somewhere

stuff.中释: 装， 填， 塞； 让…吃饱
stuff.英释: to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way

widow.英释: a woman whose husband has died and who has not married again

whale.英释: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

inner.英释: on the inside or close to the centre of something

nerve.中释: 神经； 勇敢， 胆量
nerve.英释: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

eagle.英释: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

topic.中释: 题目， 论题， 话题
topic.英释: a subject that people talk or write about

sheer.中释: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
sheer.英释: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

nylon.英释: a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc

sauce.英释: a thick cooked liquid that is served with food to give it a particular taste

draft.英释: to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

giant.中释: 巨人，巨物；才智超群的人
giant.英释: an extremely tall strong man, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories

globe.中释: 地球， 世界； 地球仪； 球体
globe.英释: a round object with a map of the Earth drawn on it

prove.中释: 证实， 证明； 结果是
prove.英释: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

drain.中释: 耗竭； 排水沟， 排水管
drain.英释: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away

amuse.英释: to make time pass in an enjoyable way, so that you do not get bored

civil.中释: 公民的； 文职的； 民用的； 民事的， 民法的； 文明的
civil.英释: relating to the people who live in a country

panel.中释: 专门小组； 面， 板； 控制板， 仪表盘
panel.英释: a board in a car, plane, boat etc that has the controls on it

ditch.英释: a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water

burst.英释: the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

lucky.中释: 幸运的， 侥幸的； 吉利的

clash.中释: 冲突； 不协调； 刺耳的撞击声
clash.英释: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports

lemon.中释: 柠檬； 柠檬树； 柠檬黄， 淡黄色
lemon.英释: a fruit with a hard yellow skin and sour juice

await.中释: 等候； 期待； 将降临到…身上

bound.中释: 跳跃； 界限， 限制
bound.英释: a long or high jump made with a lot of energy

breed.英释: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm

realm.中释: 界， 领域， 范围； 王国， 国度
realm.英释: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

crowd.英释: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

crown.英释: a mark, sign,  badge  etc in the shape of a crown, used especially to show rank or quality

lower.英释: to reduce something in amount, degree, strength etc, or to become less

index.中释: 索引； 指数， 指标
index.英释: an alphabetical list of names, subjects etc at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found

widen.英释: to become wider, or to make something wider

angle.中释: 角， 角度； 观点， 立场
angle.英释: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

bacon.英释: salted or smoked meat from the back or sides of a pig, often served in narrow thin pieces

pants.中释: 长裤， 便裤； 内裤
pants.英释: a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg

split.英释: a tear or crack in something made of cloth, wood etc

claim.中释: 要求， 认领， 索赔； 声称； 断言
claim.英释: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

kneel.英释: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

entry.中释: 入口处； 登记； 进入； 参赛者名单； 条目
entry.英释: the act of going into something

bunch.英释: to hold or tie things together in a bunch

tense.英释: any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

candy.英释: a sweet food made from sugar or chocolate

niece.英释: the daughter of your brother or sister, or the daughter of your wife’s or husband’s brother or sister

brick.中释: 砖， 砖块， 砖状物
brick.英释: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

brief.英释: a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

drill.英释: a method of teaching students, sports players etc something by making them repeat the same lesson, exercise etc many times

clerk.中释: 店员， 办事员， 职员
clerk.英释: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

equip.中释: 装备， 配备； 使有准备
equip.英释: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

pulse.英释: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body

mould.中释: 用模子做， 浇铸； 使形成， 把…铸造成
mould.英释: to shape a soft substance by pressing or rolling it or by putting it into a mould

elbow.英释: to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

salad.英释: a mixture of raw vegetables, especially  lettuce  ,  cucumber  , and tomato

stoop.英释: if you have a stoop, your shoulders are bent forward

upper.中释: 上面的， 地位较高的
upper.英释: in a higher position than something else

exert.英释: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

brand.中释: 铭刻， 打烙印于； 加污名于， 谴责
brand.英释: When you brand an animal, you put a permanent mark on its skin in order to show who it belongs to, usually by burning a mark onto its skin

glory.中释: 光荣， 荣誉的事； 美丽
glory.英释: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot

adopt.中释: 收养； 采用， 采取； 正式通过， 批准
adopt.英释: to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent

motor.英释: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

cabin.中释: 小屋； 船舱， 机舱
cabin.英释: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

audio.英释: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

apart.英释: If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

brake.英释: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop

naval.英释: relating to the navy or used by the navy

forge.中释: 打制， 锻造； 伪造
forge.英释: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real

vivid.中释: 鲜艳的； 生动的， 栩栩如生的
vivid.英释: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

honey.中释: 蜜， 蜂蜜； 甜， 甜蜜； [常用于称呼] 宝贝儿
honey.英释: a sweet sticky substance produced by  bees  , used as food

screw.英释: to attach one thing to another using a screw

argue.中释: 争论，争辩，辩论；主张；说服
argue.英释: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way

proof.英释: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

phase.中释: 阶段； 方面； 相， 相位
phase.英释: one of the stages of a process of development or change

exact.英释: to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

force.中释: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
force.英释: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

ghost.英释: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

cease.英释: to stop doing something or stop happening

queue.英释: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move

magic.英释: the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions

onion.英释: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.

hedge.英释: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

aware.英释: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists

drama.中释: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
drama.英释: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

stove.英释: a thing used for heating a room or for cooking, which works by burning wood, coal, oil, or gas

alarm.英释: to make someone feel worried or frightened

lorry.英释: a large vehicle for carrying heavy goods

ounce.英释: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.

beach.英释: an area of sand or small stones at the edge of the sea or a lake

bench.英释: a long seat for two or more people, especially outdoors

quiet.英释: not making much noise, or making no noise at all

water.英释: if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them

fight.英释: to take part in a war or battle

dirty.英释: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

lever.英释: a stick or handle on a machine or piece of equipment, that you move to operate it

climb.英释: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do

worth.英释: how good or useful something is or how important it is to people

brood.英释: if a bird broods, it sits on its eggs to make the young birds break out

youth.英释: the quality or state of being young

order.英释: to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

stage.英释: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

hatch.英释: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

apple.英释: a hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside

never.英释: not at any time, or not once

idiom.英释: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

child.英释: someone who is not yet an adult

stair.英释: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

steel.英释: strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and  carbon

guard.英释: someone whose job is to protect a place or person

money.英释: what you earn by working and can use to buy things. Money can be in the form of notes and coins or cheques, and can be kept in a bank

juice.英释: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

canoe.英释: a long light boat that is pointed at both ends and which you move along using a  paddle

break.英释: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

limit.英释: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

price.英释: the amount of money you have to pay for something

learn.英释: to gain knowledge of a subject or skill, by experience, by studying it, or by being taught

aural.英释: relating to the sense of hearing, or someone’s ability to understand sounds

clasp.英释: a small metal object for fastening a bag, belt, piece of jewellery etc

clock.英释: an instrument that shows what time it is, in a room or outside on a building

doubt.英释: to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

plane.英释: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine

queen.英释: the female ruler of a country

month.英释: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

trust.英释: to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

quick.英释: lasting for or taking only a short time

berry.英释: a small soft fruit with small seeds

model.英释: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

early.英释: in the first part of a period of time, event, or process

catch.英释: to trap an animal or fish by using a trap, net, or hook, or by hunting it

liner.英释: a passenger ship or airplane run by a shipping line or airline

noise.英释: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

alloy.英释: a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

feast.英释: a large meal where a lot of people celebrate a special occasion

group.英释: to come together and form a group, or to arrange things or people together in a group

music.英释: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices in a way that is pleasant or exciting

heart.英释: the part of you that feels strong emotions and feelings

bread.英释: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked

touch.英释: the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone

judge.英释: the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

happy.英释: having feelings of pleasure, for example because something good has happened to you or you are very satisfied with your life

glide.英释: a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort

cloud.英释: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water

taste.英释: the sense by which you know one food from another

cubic.英释: relating to a measurement of space which is calculated by multiplying the length of something by its width and height

floor.英释: the flat surface that you stand on inside a building

guess.英释: an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

groan.英释: a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something

fable.英释: a traditional short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals

noisy.英释: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise

cough.英释: a medical condition that makes you cough a lot

muddy.英释: covered with mud or containing mud

meter.英释: a machine that measures and shows the amount of something you have used or the amount of money that you must pay

eager.英释: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

penny.英释: a small unit of money in Britain. There are 100 pence in one pound.

dream.英释: to have a dream while you are asleep

diary.英释: a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day

goose.英释: a bird that is like a duck but is larger and makes loud noises

pupil.英释: someone who is being taught, especially a child

wheat.英释: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on

cross.英释: to go across; to pass or stretch from one side to the other

flush.英释: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed

could.英释: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past

Latin.英释: the language used in ancient Rome

other.英释: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

great.英释: very large in amount or degree

ought.英释: it is morally right to do a particular thing or that it is morally right for a particular situation to exist, especially when giving or asking for advice or opinions.

green.英释: the colour of grass and leaves

press.英释: to push something firmly against a surface

trade.英释: to buy and sell goods, services etc as your job or business

often.英释: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

paper.英释: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

truth.英释: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

reply.英释: something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

close.英释: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

found.英释: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

hello.英释: used as a greeting when you see or meet someone

chalk.英释: soft white or grey rock formed a long time ago from the shells of small sea animals

chain.英释: a series of metal rings which are joined together in a line and used for fastening things, supporting weights, decoration etc

paint.英释: to put paint on a surface

pause.英释: to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

ninth.英释: one of nine equal parts of something

horse.英释: a large strong animal that people ride and use for pulling heavy things

knife.英释: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon

metal.英释: a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel

basin.英释: a round container attached to the wall in a bathroom, where you wash your hands and face

shear.英释: to cut the wool off a sheep;to cut off someone’s hair

greet.英释: to say hello to someone or welcome them

brute.英释: a man who treats people in an unkind, cruel way

large.英释: big in size, amount, or number

brain.英释: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move

fault.英释: a bad or weak part of someone’s character

dance.英释: a special set of movements performed to a particular type of music

north.英释: in the north or facing the north

leave.英释: to go away from a place or a person

birth.英释: the time when a baby comes out of its mother’s body

silly.英释: not sensible, or showing bad judgment

shelf.英释: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

later.英释: after the time you are talking about or after the present time

daily.英释: a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday

offer.英释: a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

glass.英释: a transparent solid substance used for making windows, bottles etc

cheer.英释: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something

level.英释: flat and not sloping in any direction

every.英释: used with singular nouns to refer to all the members of a group of things or people

nurse.英释: to look after someone who is ill or injured

goods.英释: things which are carried by road, train etc

coast.英释: the area where the land meets the sea

above.英释: in a higher position than something else

proud.中释: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
proud.英释: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

cause.英释: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

mouth.英释: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

March.英释: the third month of the year, between February and April

alone.英释: without any help from other people

treat.英释: something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

bough.英释: a main branch on a tree

cloth.英释: material used for making things such as clothes

print.英释: writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

cruel.英释: having a desire to cause pain and suffering

guide.英释: to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them

trick.英释: to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

awake.英释: to wake up, or to make someone wake up

Roman.英释: connected with the modern city of Rome

power.英释: the ability or right to control people or events

badly.英释: in an unsatisfactory or unsuccessful way

carry.英释: to have something with you in your pocket, on your belt, in your bag etc everywhere you go

tower.英释: to be much taller than the people or things around you

flare.英释: to burn brightly, but usually for only a short time or not steadily

linen.英释: cloth made from the flax plant, used to make high quality clothes, home decorations etc

April.英释: the fourth month of the year, between March and May

match.英释: an organized sports event between two teams or people

wound.英释: to injure someone with a knife, gun etc

grade.英释: a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has

piece.英释: to put all the separate parts of sth together to make a complete whole

robot.英释: a machine that can move and do some of the work of a person, and is usually controlled by a computer

serve.英释: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want

madam.英释: used to address a woman in a polite way, especially a customer in a shop

India.英释: a republic in the Asian subcontinent in southern Asia; second most populous country in the world; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1947

humid.英释: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

rainy.英释: a rainy period of time is one when it rains a lot

fruit.英释: something that grows on a plant, tree, or bush, can be eaten as a food, contains seeds or a stone, and is usually sweet

pound.英释: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 16  ounce s  or 0.454 kilograms

color.英释: red, blue, yellow, green, brown, purple etc

laugh.英释: the act of laughing or the sound you make when you laugh

bring.英释: to take something or someone with you to the place where you are now, or to the place you are talking about

among.英释: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

booth.英释: a small confined place where you can do sth privately, for example make a telephone call

final.英释: last in a series of actions, events, parts of a story etc

miner.英释: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

house.英释: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family

enemy.英释: someone who hates you and wants to harm you

cream.英释: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk

clear.英释: to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

hurry.英释: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time

chess.英释: a game for two players, who move their playing pieces according to particular rules across a special board to try to trap their opponent’s king

knock.英释: a sharp blow from sth hard

tempt.英释: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

peach.英释: a round juicy fruit that has a soft yellow or red skin and a large, hard seed in the centre, or the tree that this fruit grows on

plate.英释: to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver

party.英释: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc

radio.英释: when messages are sent or received in this way

piano.英释: a large musical instrument that has a long row of black and white  key s  . You play the piano by sitting in front of it and pressing the keys.

chair.英释: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, which has a back, a seat, and four legs

count.英释: to calculate the total number of things or people in a group

metre.英释: the basic unit for measuring length in the  metric system

earth.英释: the planet that we live on

ocean.英释: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface

check.英释: the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

cheap.英释: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

false.英释: a statement, story etc that is false is completely untrue

guest.英释: a person that you have invited to your house or to a particular event that you are paying for

aloud.英释: in a voice that other people can hear

shoot.英释: the part of a plant that comes up above the ground when it is just beginning to grow, or a new part that grows on an existing plant

ahead.英释: further forward in space or time; in front

manly.英释: having qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong

dread.英释: to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

elder.英释: a member of a tribe or other social group who is important and respected because they are old

store.英释: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

gauge.英释: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something

plain.英释: very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

least.英释: less than anything or anyone else

point.英释: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

ready.英释: fully prepared for what you are going to do

exist.英释: to be present in a place or situation

prize.英释: to think that someone or something is very important or valuable

grass.英释: a common wild plant with narrow green leaves and stems that are eaten by cows, horses, sheep, etc.

novel.英释: not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

hotel.英释: a building where people pay to stay and eat meals

build.英释: to make something, especially a building or something large

bosom.英释: the front part of a woman’s chest

again.英释: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before

basic.英释: forming the most important or most necessary part of something

cloak.英释: a warm piece of clothing like a coat without sleeves that hangs loosely from your shoulders

fifth.英释: one of five equal parts of something

brush.英释: an object that you use for cleaning, painting, making your hair tidy etc, made with a lot of hairs,  bristle s  , or thin pieces of plastic, fastened to a handle

angel.中释: 天使；安琪儿，天使〔指仁慈、善良或美丽的人〕
angel.英释: a  spirit  who is God’s servant in heaven, and who is often shown as a person dressed in white with wings

class.英释: a group of students who are taught together

black.英释: having the darkest colour, like coal or night

fence.英释: a structure made of wood, metal etc that surrounds a piece of land

hasty.英释: Done with excessive speed or urgency; hurried

drive.英释: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

night.英释: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep

movie.英释: a film made to be shown at the cinema or on television

lunch.英释: a meal eaten in the middle of the day

death.英释: a creature that looks like a human  skeleton  , used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die

sweep.英释: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

depth.英释: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of sth

habit.英释: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

odour.英释: a smell, especially an unpleasant one

enter.英释: to come or go into sth

angry.英释: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

Asian.英释: someone from Asia, or whose family originally came from Asia, especially India or Pakistan

dress.英释: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion

might.英释: if something might happen or might be true, there is a possibility that it may happen or may be true, but you are not at all certain

brown.英释: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

field.英释: an area of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals feed on grass

about.英释: concerning or relating to a particular subject

mourn.英释: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

drown.英释: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

carve.英释: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

rapid.英释: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

place.英释: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc

sheet.英释: a large piece of thin cloth that you put on a bed to lie on or lie under

melon.英释: a large round fruit with sweet juicy flesh

peace.英释: a situation or a period of time in which there is no war or violence in a country or an area

pride.英释: to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

after.英释: next to and following sb/sth in order or importance

actor.英释: someone who performs in a play or film

fever.英释: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature

below.英释: at or to a lower level or position than sb/sth

mouse.英释: a small furry animal with a pointed nose and a long tail that lives in people’s houses or in fields

blood.英释: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body

agree.英释: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

cover.英释: a thing that is put over or on another thing, usually to protect it or to decorate it

blaze.英释: to burn very brightly and strongly

wheel.英释: one of the round things under a car, bus, bicycle etc that turns when it moves

refer.英释: to mention or speak about sb/sth

shore.英释: the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

front.英释: the part of something that is furthest forward in the direction that it is facing or moving

maybe.英释: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain
